results.title: Moving story
results.brief_description: Provides a brief history of trades shipping in Australia and goes on to outline the function of the Australia to Europe Shipping Conference. The conference comprises eighteen major international shipping companies including the Australian National Line which cooperate to provide a coordinated shipping service for the carriage of Australian exports to Europe at agreed freight rates. Highlights how the merger of technological and management skills can offer efficient service at reasonable rates. Suitable for upper secondary and teacher/tertiary levels.

results.title: Movietone news
results.brief_description: Movietone cinemagazine items include: A new series of fire extinguishers and fire prevention demonstrated; presentation of gallantry awards by the Duchess of Kent at the Royal National Lifeboat Institute; description of a new rescue boat; displays of English fashion for export; a report on cemetary damage by vandals at Basingstoke; footage of new “crazes” - surfsailing and surf-racing.

results.title: Mouth to mouth rescue breathing
results.creator_credit: Walter Reed Army Institute of Research
results.brief_description: A record of an experiment at the Baltimore City Hospital Department of Anesthiology, in the methods and effectiveness of mouth-to-mouth rescue breathing in comparison with back pressure artificial respiration.

results.title: Mount Lofty Ranges: a total picture
results.brief_description: Investigates how life in this delicate ecological system affects all South Australians and the conservation and development options now necessary to protect our environmentally threatened Ranges. It asks the question “Can we cater for the changing land - use demands and still maintain a balanced environment?”
results.description: Investigates how life in this delicate ecological system affects all South Australians and the conservation and development options now necessary to protect our environmentally threatened Ranges. results.title: Motion study in action
results.creator_credit: Ralph Barnes and University of Iowa
results.brief_description: Shows principles of motion economy applied to many kinds of manual work. Old and new methods are shown for twelve different jobs, including the following: Sorting incoming orders; assembling and attaching buckles on shoes; opening cartons; placing pies in bags and filling glasses with ice and water.

results.title: Motion Pictures produced by Lubin Manufacturing Company, 1904-1909
results.brief_description:
Compilation of silent motion pictures produced by Lubin Manufacturing Company (Philadelphia).
Contents: Bold bank robbery (1904)—She would be an actress (1904)—Drunkard’s child (1909)—An Unexpected guest (1909)
Films restored from the Library of Congress paper prints.

results.title: Mother may I?
results.creator_credit: Linda Feferman, Gina Blumenfeld and Shared Futures Films
results.brief_description: SEX EDUCATION - Treats aspects of teeage sexuality in a narrative context. A sixteen-year-old girl fears that she may be pregnant but is reluctant to confide in her parents. Depicts her reactions to her predicament, as well as those of her boyfriend and eleven-year-old sister who share her anxiety. Raises issues surrounding pregnancy, adoption, abortion, and family relationships. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
